business.headline: Explained: How to vacation without the financial hangoverA dream vacation should leave you with great memories, not months of financial stress. With a little planning, you can enjoy the trip and return home without breaking your budget.

Stock markets slide amid US-Iran tensions: Buy the dip or wait it out?The Nifty 50 fell 257.25 points to 24,855.15, and the BSE Sensex was down 863.78 points to 81,544.39 as of 9:49 am. Broader indices mirrored the decline, with both mid- and small-cap indices slipping sharply.

Sensex tumbles 700 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At around 9:19 am, the BSE Sensex was down 580 points, trading at 81,828.11, while the NSE Nifty50 fell over 175 points to 24,937.25. Broader market indices mirrored the slide, and volatility indicators jumped sharply, signalling a bumpy trading session ahead.
Sensex, Nifty sink in early trade as US-Iran conflict rattles investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 791.58 points to 81,616.59, while the NSE Nifty lost 244.25 points to 24,868.15 as of 9:53 am.

Arisinfra Solutions IPO allotment out: Here's how to check status and latest GMPInvestors who took part in the public issue can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the official registrar for the IPO, Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to crash today after US attack on Iran?The Gift Nifty futures, as of 8:10 am, were trading at 25,015, indicating a lower opening compared to the previous close of 25,112.4. Benchmark indices rose about 1.6% last week, driven by gains in financial stocks, which provided some cushion against the geopolitical tensions.

Stocks to watch on June 23: TCS, Waree Renewable, HAL, BEL, MakeMyTripReports suggest the United States may have bombed a nuclear facility in Iran, triggering fresh concerns over the conflict with Israel. These developments could impact market sentiment on Dalal Street at the start of the week.

Why India may not feel the heat if Iran closes Strait of HormuzIndia, which has traditionally sourced its oil from the Middle East and more recently from Russia, is unlikely to see a major impact on its energy reserves if Iran decides to shut down the vital oil corridor of the Strait of Hormuz.

Generative AI must pay for using copyright content, says DNPAThe Digital News Publishers Association said it "firmly believes that utilising the content of digital news publishers, without consent, for AI training and subsequent generative AI applications, such as search assistance and information purposes, constitutes an infringement of copyright."

Two new GST levies may replace compensation cess, but at what cost?Health and Clean Energy levies may replace the Compensation Cess, but tax experts warn of rising compliance burdens and fresh coordination challenges.

Tesla to open first showroom in Mumbai next month, sell China-made EVs: ReportTesla is set to open its first showroom in Mumbai next month and sell Model Y rear-wheel-drive SUVs shipped from Tesla's China factory as the company seeks expansion in the world's third-biggest automobile market, Bloomberg News reported.

India's growth lies in its heartland: Adani Enterprises Director Pranav AdaniThe remarks came as part of a broader statement of intent from the newly launched Chintan Research Foundation, which Adani said would focus on three critical areas: climate change, trade, and geopolitics.

entertainment.headline: Dhanush touches Chiranjeevi's feet at Kuberaa event, says he's our OMNagarjuna, Dhanush, and Rashmika Mandanna's latest release 'Kuberaa' refuses to slow down at the box office. The team recently held a grand event to celebrate the film's success.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 3: Aamir Khan does the unthinkable in 1st weekend'Sitaare Zameen Par' finished its opening weekend on a glorious run at the box office. The Aamir Khan film collected around Rs 60 crore nett in three days, and now it's looking at a very promising Monday to beat the lifetime collection of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

Anupamaa set catches fire: Cine association seeks action, no injuries reportedA massive fire broke out on the set of the popular TV show 'Anupamaa' in Mumbai's Film City early Monday, completely gutting the set just before shooting was about to begin. Fortunately, no one was injured, even though several crew members were present at the time.

Actor Mamitha asked Vijay if Jana Nayagan was his last film. His reply thrilled fansThalapathy Vijay had initially announced that 'Jana Nayagan' would be his last film so he could concentrate on his politics. Recently, actor Mamitha Baiju talked about the conversation she had with him about his final film

Samay Raina's Latent show returns on YouTube after row, fans ask for new contentComedian Samay Raina's popular show, 'India's Got Latent's clips resurfaced on YouTube, sparking excitement among fans, with many wondering if there are going to be new episodes soon.

Karisma Kapoor, Kareena-Saif offer prayers at Sunjay Kapur's memorial meetKarisma Kapoor, along with her children, Samaira and Kiaan, attended the prayer meet of her ex-husband Sunjay Kapur in Delhi. The actor was joined by her sister Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan.

Diljit Dosanjh skips India release of Sardaar Ji 3 starring Pak actor Hania Aamir'Sardaar Ji 3', featuring Diljit Dosanjh and Pakistani actor Hania Aamir, will not release in India due to the Indian film industry's ban on Pakistani actors. The film is set for an overseas release on June 27 and is a horror comedy satire on ghostbusting.

Actor Trisha calls Thalapathy Vijay bestest in adorable birthday post. Viral picActor Trisha Krishnan shared a cute birthday post for her long-time friend, Thalapathy Vijay. She called him 'bestest' in her Instagram post.

Salman Khan's casual Sunday vibe wins fans over. See picActor Salman Khan on Sunday shared his new photo on Instagram. The photo created excitement amongst his fans, who complimented his style and mannerisms.

Jaideep Ahlawat joins King, says Shah Rukh Khan convinced Siddharth AnandActor Jaideep Ahlawat will also be seen in the much-anticipated film 'King'. The actor confirmed joining the cast and said that director Siddharth Anand was initially hesitant to offer him the film.

Thalapathy Vijay turns 51: Atlee, Dulquer Salman and celebs extend wishesThalapathy Vijay, who is celebrating his 51th birthday on Sunday, received wishes from the big wigs of Tamil film industry. Filmmaker Atlee shared a picture of fans celebrating the re-release of 'Mersal' to wish the actor on Instagram.

Kajol says love stories have evolved but DDLJ would still win hearts todayKajol feels that while love stories have evolved with time, a classic like 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge' would still resonate with today's audience. In an exclusive interview with India Today, she emphasised that timeless films with strong storytelling and memorable music continue to hold their charm.

Karisma Kapoor in Delhi with Kareena and Saif for Sunjay Kapur's prayer meetActor Karisma Kapoor is in New Delhi with her family to attend the prayer service of her ex-husband Sunjay Kapoor. Actors Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan also accompanied her.

Salman Khan reacts to trespassing incident at Galaxy: Definitely didn't call herA month after the trespassing incident at his Galaxy apartment, Salman Khan reacted to the incident. He addressed it during his appearance on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'.

Case against actor Vijay Deverakonda under SC/ST Act for remarks on tribal community A case has been filed against actor Vijay Deverakonda for his remarks on the tribal community at Suriya's 'Retro' event. Vijay had issued an apology.

Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty get lost in Pune, board crowded metro to reach hotelActors Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty travelled in a crowded metro recently after they got lost in Pune. They are shooting for 'Border 2' in the city.

Rapper Tommy Genesis faces backlash for dressing as Maa Kali in explicit music videoA Canadian rapper is facing backlash for portraying Maa Kali in an explicit video. The act has sparked outrage and renewed debate over cultural appropriation in entertainment.

Kuberaa box office Day 2: Dhanush's crime-thriller shows growth, crosses Rs 30 crore'Kuberaa' is going strong at the box office and has earned Rs 30 crore. On day 2, the Dhanush-starrer earned Rs 16 crore at the box office.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 2: Aamir's film outshines itself, earns Rs 30 croreAamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' is steadily winning over audiences, showing promising signs at the box office. Boosted by positive word of mouth, the film continued to draw consistent footfall on Day 2, reflecting growing momentum after a solid opening.

general news.headline: 'Bullseye!!' Trump says monumental damage to Iran nuke sites in US strikesThe strikes came as a major escalation and the first direct US military involvement in the conflict alongside Israel.

BJP leads in 2 Gujarat seats, Congress in Nilambur, AAP in Ludhiana West  Live UpdatesAssembly Bypoll Result 2025 Live Updates: The bypoll results for five constituencies across four states - Bengal, Punjab, Kerala and Gujarat - will be announced today. Bypolls were held in two seats in Gujarat - Visavadar and Kadi - and one each in Punjab (Ludhiana West), Kerala (Nilambur) and Bengal (Kaliganj).

Prime asset for India: Shashi Tharoor's big praise for PM on Op Sindoor outreachCongress MP Shashi Tharoor has once again heaped praise on Prime Minister Narendra Modi in a column on Operation Sindoor global outreach mission, saying the latter is a "prime asset for India".

Hands off Iran: Anti-war protests flood US cities after strikes on nuclear sitesAnti-war protests erupted across several major US cities on Sunday, including New York and Washington DC, after America bombed three Iranian nuclear sites as part of 'Operation Midnight Hammer', marking a major escalation in the Middle East crisis.

Watch: US B-2 bombers that dropped massive bunker-busters on Iran return homeThe B-2 stealth bombers that struck Iran's nuclear sites have safely returned to Whiteman Air Force Base in Missouri. The mission, named Operation Midnight Hammer, involved 7 B-2s and over 125 US aircraft, delivering a precise strike on key nuclear facilities in Iran.

Yashasvi slammed for dropped catches as India slip to 5-year low in Leeds TestENG vs IND, 1st Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal's multiple dropped catches put India under pressure in the Headingley Test. Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul helped India secure a narrow lead despite fielding setbacks.

Congress slams Trump for bombing Iran: Mockery of his own call for dialogueCongress leader Jairam Ramesh slammed Donald Trump for using American air power on Iran's nuclear site, while questioning the Modi government's silence in the Middle East fallout.

Bustling with activity: Omar Abdullah shares lively tourist scenes from PahalgamBack in Pahalgam for his second visit in a month, Omar Abdullah shared images of crowded streets and traffic jams as Kashmir began to see the first signs of a tourism revival.

Iran to block key oil choke point after US strikes? Why Strait of Hormuz mattersA final decision on whether Tehran will close the energy chokepoint will be taken by the Supreme National Security Council. If Iran does go ahead, it is likely to disrupt trade flows, and send oil prices shooting up.

Iran fires fresh missile at central Israel, Tel Aviv says it was interceptedIran's media have claimed that the nuclear sites destroyed in Sunday's US bombings are presently being rebuilt by Iran's Atomic Energy Agency. Meanwhile, the US State Department has issued a Worldwide Caution alert, warning American citizens to exercise increased vigilance while travelling abroad. 

The Israeli Defence Forces also stated that around 20 Israeli Air Force fighter jets carried out intelligence-based strikes using over 30 munitions across several locations in Iran, including Kermanshah, Hamedan, and Tehran.

Operation Midnight Hammer: US details how it struck Iran's N-sites in 25 minutesOperation Midnight Hammer - This was the name given by the US following its air strikes on Iran's three nuclear sites. It involved over 125 aircraft and bombers being deployed in the Pacific as a "decoy" in an operation that lasted 25 minutes.

Karun Nair comeback story: One more chance, 3006 days laterIndia tour of England: Karun Nair returned to the Test side after 3006 days, earning a place in Shubman Gill's new-look India. After a record-breaking triple century in 2016, he had vanished from the team without a goodbye. But he never gave up.

Karisma Kapoor, Kareena-Saif offer prayers at Sunjay Kapur's memorial meetKarisma Kapoor, along with her children, Samaira and Kiaan, attended the prayer meet of her ex-husband Sunjay Kapur in Delhi. The actor was joined by her sister Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan.

Case against Jagan Reddy after party supporter dies under convoy vehicle in AndhraAndhra Pradesh Police have registered a case against former chief minister Jagan Mohan Reddy and several others after a man died, reportedly hit by a car in his convoy.

Enemy made grave big mistake, must be punished: Khamenei on US strikesIran's Supreme Leader Khamenei condemned US strikes on nuclear sites, warning of harsh retaliation. He called the attacks a grave crime by the "Zionist enemy" that must be punished. Iran's President also warned of a strong response to US aggression.

Explained: How to vacation without the financial hangoverA dream vacation should leave you with great memories, not months of financial stress. With a little planning, you can enjoy the trip and return home without breaking your budget.

Samay Raina's Latent show returns on YouTube after row, fans ask for new contentComedian Samay Raina's popular show, 'India's Got Latent's clips resurfaced on YouTube, sparking excitement among fans, with many wondering if there are going to be new episodes soon.

Why India may not feel the heat if Iran closes Strait of HormuzIndia, which has traditionally sourced its oil from the Middle East and more recently from Russia, is unlikely to see a major impact on its energy reserves if Iran decides to shut down the vital oil corridor of the Strait of Hormuz.

Did US use Indian airspace to strike Iran nuke sites? Government clarifiesThe Press Information Bureau (PIB) in a fact check, said that the route taken by the B2 bombers was explained by US Joint Chiefs of Staff Chair Gen. Dan Caine during a press briefing and Indian airspace was not used for the strike.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 3: Aamir Khan does the unthinkable in 1st weekend'Sitaare Zameen Par' finished its opening weekend on a glorious run at the box office. The Aamir Khan film collected around Rs 60 crore nett in three days, and now it's looking at a very promising Monday to beat the lifetime collection of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

IndiGo airhostess welcomes parents on flight as lead cabin crew in wholesome videoParmita Roy, who was serving as the lead cabin crew on the IndiGo flight, welcomed her parents onboard in a moment she described as her "dream flight".

What US strikes on Iran N-sites could lead to: 5 big pointsUS President Donald Trump's decision to do what he vowed not to could lead to a shake-up in the Middle East. The strikes curb Iran's power while revealing American assertions. However, this could also lead to another "forever war" for the US and skyrocketing oil prices for the world.

Live: Congress leads in Kerala's Nilambur bypoll in early trendsAssembly Bypoll Result 2025 Live Updates: Nilambur by-election counting is underway after the voting on June 19. The counting began at 8 am. The bypoll was necessitated after PV Anvar resigned in January.

AAP's Sanjeev Arora widens lead over Congress rival after Round 4Ludhiana West Assembly Results Live Updates: The race for the Ludhiana (West) Assembly seat of Punjab is going to be a four-way contest with the Arvind Kejriwal-led Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) looking to retain the seat following sitting party MLA Gurpreet Singh Gogi's death. The party has fielded Rajya Sabha MP Sanjeev Arora to retain its hold on the urban seat. Arora faces Bharat Bhushan Ashu from the Congress, Jiwan Gupta from the BJP, and Parupkar Singh Ghumman from the Shiromani Akali Dal. Among the five Assembly seats that went to bypolls on June 19, Ludhiana (West) recorded the lowest voter turnout at 51.33%. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

sports.headline: Bumrah as valuable as Kohinoor: Karthik praises pacer after Leeds heroicsFormer India cricketer Dinesh Karthik couldn't hide his admiration for Jasprit Bumrah, describing him as, valuable as the Kohinoor diamond" while pointing out that the Indian pacer holds the best bowling average (19.33) among all 86 bowlers in Test history with 200 or more wickets."

Aided by cold England weather, Bumrah hints at playing more than 3 TestsEngland vs India: Jasprit Bumrah has indicated he might play more than 3 Tests in England as he feels fresh in cold conditions. His availability will be invaluable in overseas conditions.

Real Madrid beat Pachua despite early red, Manchester City and Juventus advanceTen-man Real Madrid showed their depth and resilience, while Manchester City delivered a ruthless attacking display, as both European giants secured key victories in the Club World Cup group stage on Sunday.

Karun Nair comeback story: One more chance, 3006 days laterIndia tour of England: Karun Nair returned to the Test side after 3006 days, earning a place in Shubman Gill's new-look India. After a record-breaking triple century in 2016, he had vanished from the team without a goodbye. But he never gave up.

Jasprit Bumrah is an absolute genius: Hussain likens India pacer to WarneFormer England captain Nasser Hussain lavished praise on Jasprit Bumrah, calling him an "absolute genius" and comparing his ability to leave batters clueless to that of legendary leg-spinner Shane Warne.

Double Olympic medallist Lalit Upadhyay retires from international hockeyTwo-time Olympic medallist and Indian forward Lalit Kumar Upadhyay announced his retirement from international hockey on Sunday, shortly after India concluded their FIH Pro League campaign with a 4-3 victory over Belgium.

Little bit of Rishabh Pant in Harry Brook: Pujara makes bold comparisonCheteshwar Pujara made a bold comparison as he saw glimpses of Rishabh Pant in English batting star Harry Brook. The latter scored 99 runs, narrowly missing out on a century, but his contribution was crucial in helping England secure a slender first-innings lead

Total team man KL Rahul doesn't know how good a player he is: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that KL Rahul is yet to achieve his full potential after the Indian opener made another fine start with the bat for India against England. Rahul remained unbeaten on 47 as India ended the day on 90 for two.

Let the noise do its thing: Pope backed his instincts to hit hundred in LeedsOllie Pope revealed that despite recent criticism, he chose to back himself and trust his instincts approach that led to his return to form, as he looks to cement his place as England's number three batter in the long run.

Shastri slams sloppy fielding as England narrows lead at HeadingleyRavi Shastri was critical of India's fielding efforts in the Leeds Test, saying that they should have had a 150-plus lead at the end of England's first innings. The Indian fielders gave the likes of Ben Duckett, Ollie Pope, and Harry Brook lifelines in Leeds, and England ultimately conceded just a six-run lead.

Don't want to create a scene: Jasprit Bumrah on India's poor fielding efforts on Day 3Jasprit Bumrah shared his thoughts after missing out on a few wickets due to dropped catches and no-balls. The pacer said he has no intention of putting additional pressure on his teammates, adding that such moments are part and parcel of the game.

Little bit of Rishabh Pant in Harry Brook: Pujara makes bold comparisonCheteshwar Pujara made a bold comparison as he saw glimpses of Rishabh Pant in English batting star Harry Brook. The latter scored 99 runs, narrowly missing out on a century, but his contribution was crucial in helping England secure a slender first-innings lead

Total team man KL Rahul doesn't know how good a player he is: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that KL Rahul is yet to achieve his full potential after the Indian opener made another fine start with the bat for India against England. Rahul remained unbeaten on 47 as India ended the day on 90 for two.

Let the noise do its thing: Pope backed his instincts to hit hundred in LeedsOllie Pope revealed that despite recent criticism, he chose to back himself and trust his instincts approach that led to his return to form, as he looks to cement his place as England's number three batter in the long run.

Shastri slams sloppy fielding as England narrows lead at HeadingleyRavi Shastri was critical of India's fielding efforts in the Leeds Test, saying that they should have had a 150-plus lead at the end of England's first innings. The Indian fielders gave the likes of Ben Duckett, Ollie Pope, and Harry Brook lifelines in Leeds, and England ultimately conceded just a six-run lead.

Don't want to create a scene: Jasprit Bumrah on India's poor fielding efforts on Day 3Jasprit Bumrah shared his thoughts after missing out on a few wickets due to dropped catches and no-balls. The pacer said he has no intention of putting additional pressure on his teammates, adding that such moments are part and parcel of the game.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
